messages.message: Hi team. One suggestion. One partner deleted a project, and then forgot to refresh his browser page. It looks like the project was still appearing there, and then he deleted another project thinking that the previous one was not deleted. Is there a way of having a forced refresh of the page when a project is deleted to avoid this kind of mistake?
when a user deletes a project they should be navigated away from that project. Are you saying that this happened because they had multiple tabs open with the project/someone else deleted the project?
I believe it was in a screen when they see more than one project, and select one of them for deletion.
oh I see what behavior you’re referring to. @Jessica it looks like after a project is deleted from the Workspaces Create tab we aren’t updating the list of projects on the frontend
@fernando.piazza.ctr are you able to make an EPD bug ticket for this?

cc @Weiming Wu

I think what we want to do here is rather than remove the project from recents when it's deleted (since it can be deleted from a few different spots and this is true of other asssets as well), load the project/chats and cross check them with recents, and remove the ones that are no longer there

Sounds like a react-query caching problem - I already check whether projects exist when reading recents, and actively delete them from recents if they're not found. It could be that the project was deleted, but the query that I was relying on didn't invalidate, so the project seemed to still exist
